email.title: Weekly Digest

image.alt: Stack of chocolate chip biscuits next to a glass of milk

email.text:
Hi everyone,
Thanks to everyone who came to Games Night with G-Research and our Google Hash Code hub last week!
We have a busy week ahead, with our yearly joint event with RCSU, Vive la Revelution, taking place on Monday. In the days which follow, we will be holding an Introduction to Unity workshop, inviting Palantir for a talk and product demo and finishing the week with DoCSoc's election hustings.
Read on!
email.heading: An Introduction to Unity

event.text:
An introduction to Unity (the popular game engine used to make games like Hearthstone and Pokemon Go), how to use it, and what you can do with it.
Open to all Imperial students, no coding experience required. Bring your laptops and code along!
This session is targeted for those participating in HealthHack 19, check out: https://www.facebook.com/events/293101718230640/
Please download the latest version of Unity from the official Unity website in advance: https://unity3d.com/

email.heading: Palantir - An Engineer's Experience

event.text:
Register here: http://tinyurl.com/y63g5ag9
Come join us for an evening with Randall Dorin, one of Palantir's Forward Deployed Software Engineers, for a sneak peak of what it’s like to work at Palantir and to see first-hand a demonstration of the work Palantir has done with some of their biggest clients.
Randall graduaded from University of Arizona with a degree in Electrical Engineering. He started his professional career working at Lockheed Martin Aeronautics on the JSF program and then spent a few years as a government contractor on various IT projects for Lockheed and NGC before joining Palantir in 2010.
Food and drink will be provided! If you have any specific dietary requirements, please let us know a few days beforehand.

email.heading: DoCSoc: Meet the Candidates!

event.text:
After nominations close on Friday 1st March, it's time to Meet the Candidates!
Join us in Huxley 340 from 1pm on Friday 8th March to meet the candidates running for all of the positions in DoCSoc.
This is your chance to ask any questions you may have, and hear more about what each candidate is campaigning for! Candidates for DoCSoc and Dep Reps will all be present.
Candidates for contested positions: We'll release more preparatory information on Meet The Candidates soon. For now, think about why you'd be good for the position, and prepare to be asked some questions from the audience!

email.heading: IC HealthHack 2019

event.text:
The Department of Computing Society (DoCSoc), Bioengineering Society and ICSM Coding Society proudly present the IC HealthHack 2019!
Combining your skills in bioengineering, coding, and medicine, this Hackathon will bring together talented students from each field and will be aimed at addressing current medical challenges through technology. Over the weekend of 9-10th March 2019, teams will bring their awesome ideas to life and develop solutions to real-life healthcare challenges.
_This is NOT an overnight hackathon. The hackspace will be closed during the night and the hack spread out in two days._

email.heading: What I Wish I Knew As An Imperial Student (presented by a DeepMind employee)

event.text:
Andrea Michi is an Imperial alumni who's spent the last 3 years working for Google and DeepMind. He'll be coming in to present on everything he would have loved to know before he started his job - a talk which has been very popular when presented internally at Google.
Andrea will cover many soft topics often ignored in the tech industry: how to deal with rejections and failures, what you should prioritise at the start of your career, how to give, receive, and internalise feedback, how you can be a better teammate and a more efficient engineer.

email.heading: Palantir Women in Tech Scholarship
email.sponsor:
We launched the Palantir Women in Technology Scholarship in 2010 to celebrate and support women who are beginning careers in technology. We hope to encourage women to pursue computer science, engineering, and technical studies, and to become leaders in these fields.
This year, 10 scholarship recipients will be chosen and invited to visit our London office for a full-day, all-expenses paid developmental workshop. Programming will include professional development sessions, breakouts with our engineers, and some fun social activities! All recipients are awarded grants of £5,500 to support their education.
The scholarship is open to students who:
- Are active, full-time undergraduate or Master's students enrolled in an accredited European college/university during the academic years that the scholarship is awarded, i.e., you must be enrolled in both the current (2018-19) and upcoming (2019-20) academic years - Are majoring in or plan to major in Science, Technology, Engineering or Math (STEM) fields - Identify as women - Have not been finalists in the past
For more information, click [here](https://jobs.lever.co/palantir/2dce1c15-faca-4e91-a8aa-0c2c6a259d77) and see the flyer attached!
